title: Design and Implementation Strategies for Social Studies E-Learning on Virtual Platforms: Inquiry-Based Approaches for Civic Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level social studies expertise (understanding historical events, geospatial analysis, cultural comparison skills) and digital problem-solving abilities. Basic grasp of citizenship concepts and social science inquiry procedures
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment-driven curriculum to enhance social studies e-learning design competencies in digital device-provided environments. Focus on fostering citizenship, critical thinking, and social science inquiry skills; collaborative learning environments for real-world problem-solving.

learning_goals: Using core e-learning platform functions (assignments, discussion boards, assessment tools), learners can effectively operate social studies educational content (historical event analysis, geographic data visualization, cultural diversity comparison) and derive evidence-based conclusions.

In virtual learning environments, learners can design ≥three instructional strategies (problem-based learning, simulations, collaborative projects) that promote social studies inquiry skills (historical context understanding, geographic spatial analysis, cultural interaction awareness).

Learners can plan and produce e-learning content tailored to social studies education (history-based documentaries, geography quiz mapping, cultural comparison collaborative activities) while incorporating elements for fostering citizenship.

Learners will create an e-learning implementation roadmap (including learning objectives, content structure, technological tools, and assessment methods) applicable to actual social studies classes through project-based assessment over a 4-week course, and revise three or more core elements (e.g., historical evidence utilization, geographical data analysis, cultural context reflection) based on critical thinking and expert feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
